text: 75cl Bottle sample at Potjepalooza. Black colour, dense beige-brown head. Aroma of hard-roasted malts, bourbon, soft coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla/oak, sounds generic but this one stands out with a touch more roast than others. Flavour is sweet with roast, roasted malts, coffee, bourbon, dark chocolate, alcohol, hint of dark fruits, bittersweet finish with more roast. Full bodied, smooth. Superb stuff, love the fact it¬ís not coffee-forward.

Bottle, shared @ Potjepalooza. Thanks @PotjeBier for the hospitality and the great beers, this was the last beer of the evening as i had to catch the train back home.
I had a great day with all you guys!. 
And as a surprise i found out on the way back, this was my #4000. 
pours black with a light kaki head. 
aroma of roasted and toastes malts, coffee, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate.
lots of full dark chocolate, roasted and toasted, pretty sticky sweetness, strong alcoholic, 
love these thick and sweet bourbon stouts. !

Bottle, shared @ Potjepalooza, from an IP trade with richiesd. Black color. Light brown head, not too much. Aroma¬ís: bourbon, alcohol, roasty. Retronasal it¬ís alcohol, chocolate, fruity, sweet. Flavor is moderate sweet, roasty, alcoholic. Above medium bodied. Roasty, light bitter finish.

Shared from bottle at Potjepalooza. Black with tan head. Big sweet roasted chocolate malts, bourbon, vanilla. Big sweet sugar rush, moderate roasted bitterness. Over medium body and active soft carbonation. Big sweet stout.

Bottle shared at Potjepalooza. Black with beige head. Lots of coffee and roasted malts, vanilla, dark chocolate, some booze, cinnamon, light spices, marzipan. Quite sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied with alcoholic finish. Very nice but still a bit hot.
Big stout butt not as big as i thougt it would be. Nice bourbon notes in the tast and great smooth finish

Black color with dark brown head. Aroma has slightly acidic coffee, even a bit green with some bourbon in the background. Taste is sweet at first, fudgy, continues with sweetened coffee and bourbon, a hint of green coffee bitterness on the finish. Full bodied, medium carbonation. Really nice variation of the base beer, adds a nice flavor complexity.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 Bottle shared at a tasting. Very dark brown pour with a tan head. Easily identifiable as a speedway stout, with notes of brewed coffee, molasses, light licorice, chocolate, toffee and a ton of bourbon notes and vanilla on top of a light cherry bitterness. Well balanced flavours, a bit too boozy, though.

Tap from the source (cask) - Aroma was nice, raisin heavy, rye, wood, bourbon, tobacco chaw. Pours black with a rich, deep tan head. Somewhat flat, too mellow on the tongue. Creamy as all get out but too soft. Cherry, chocolate, fudge and bourbon.....just came across as imbalanced and disconnected to me. Maybe this isn¬ít as good on cask...not sure, but I was not impressed.
Achet√© au Vermont, partag√© avec mon grand ami Simon. Bi√®re bien balanc√©, rend honneur √† son niveau d¬íalcool. R√©putation l√©g√®rement surfaite √† mon avis ...
Really great mild bourbon flavor. Does exactly what it should do- excellent execution. The bottle is from 2012, tried it in February 2017. Really nice. Really drinkable. Solid!

Black with little brown head. Aroma is dark chocolate, slight candle wax, phenols, rum like aromas, slight smoke. Taste is sweet dark chocolate with little smokey touch and bitter finish. Only a very very little spicy in the finish. It is so incredibly smooth and drinkable, like hot chocolate or something with a little carbonation. This is it! New top 1 for me!

75cl bottle. Pours almost black with a small tan head. Aroma of strong dark malt, alcohol, red fruits, wood, some vanilla. Taste of strong sweet dark malt, chocolate, vanilla, wood, bourbon, really nice, enjoy it!

750ml bottle @ Alex¬ís. Pours an opaque black with a thin brown head. Nose is sweet bourbon, oak, and vanilla. Flavour is vanilla, some licorice, chocolate and bourbon. Overall this is very smooth and tasty.

750ml bottle (thx, Jonatahan G.!) at Alex¬ís. Vintage 2015. Pours a dark brown with a dark beige head. Aroma is sweet with bourbon, coffee and leather notes. Taste is the same, still boozy. Very good.

Sergey¬ís hunt; winter 2015Black color. Loads of phenol in the aroma, then roasted malts, burning alcohol. Medium body strength; nice chocolate flavor, hints of liquorice and coffee, tobacco and bourbon, but also very burning alcohol. The roasted liquorice in the final doesn¬ít really fit for me.
Bottle from BelgianBeerGal. Opaque black with a thin brown head. Huge aroma of vanilla, bourbon, oak. Smooth flavor with notes of chocolate, vanilla, licorice, and bourbon.
Sampel butelki w Chmielarni. ≈öwietny aromat vanilia, kakao, kokosa, kawy. W smaku podobnie, s≈Çodko i pojawiajƒÖ siƒô te≈º ciemne owoce. Bardzo g≈Çadkie, kremowe i pe≈Çne. Wybitna rzecz.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Panel #14Rami Rami is drinking a Speedway Stout (Barrel Aged) (2014) by AleSmith Brewing Company at Chmielarnia Marsza≈ÇkowskaMegabeczkowe, intensywne, gladziuchne, stopki chrystuska na gardziolku. W tle przyprawowosc, czekolada, owoce ciemne suszone. Zlozone, Super paleta. Generalnie czad, taki wow.Wygralo panel dla mnieOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
≈öwietny aromat czekolady, wanilii, kokosa i kawy. W smaku wybitne - mocno wyczuwalna beczka, czekolada i kawa. Jeden z najlepszych RIS√≥w jakie pi≈Çem.

Bottle. Pours black with medium tan head that lasts. The aroma is strong roast, wood, chocolate, vanilla. Thick body, chewy, roast, dark chocolate, wood, vanilla, nice barrel character, smooth yet complex, can always count on this beer to be amazing.

Bottle, organized by SinH4, many thanks! Aroma is thick bourbon and vanilla, but also some green apples, phenolic. Body stays super heavy and even more sweet than the others. Sticky and boozy. Still good, but not as good as hyped.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2017 2016 bottle, many thank Max! Black color with small beige head. Aroma is green apples, phenolic, ethanol, oak sugar, chocolate. Taste is again green apples and phenols, oak sugar, light tartness. Higher carbonation than the other Speedways today. Not as good as expected, it?s a bit too phenolic. A slight disappointment for Alesmith standards. Maybe this year was not as great as previous ones? Or maybe I?m becoming a BA grump now as well.

Opens up after a half hour of decanting. Still, not on par with what it should be. 8-5-8-4-16
2012 bottle, thanks Koelschtrinker. Black color with tan head. Aroma is bourbon sugar, molasses, coffee. Taste is caramel, vanilla, coffee, wood sugar, molasses again. Oily mouthfeel. Viscous body, very delicious.
Mooi, perfect zwart. Ruikt perfect. Smaakt eigenlijk ook perfext: lekker dik, vol, je proeft de barrel, alcoholisch (maar dat verwacht je ook bij 12%). Topper!

Note from a share at Proof in Tally, November ¬í16 (sorry, didn¬ít get down who brought it, but thanks!): inky black pour, brown head. aroma of vanilla, coffee, sugar, bourbon. tastes are weak in the knees amazing - dark chocolatey, light whiskey, sweet-boozy mix, vanilla, coffee, oak. Wish I had better notes. I¬íve had the base and several coffee variations and like them just fine, but the bbl is insane and maybe my favorite imp stout. Perfectly balanced. Will actively seek out.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2016 Bottle poured into a snifter showing pitch black with latte colored lacing. 

The nose shows bourbon with notes of caramel without any alcoholic heat or intensity. This is very surprising given the ABV. 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Bourbon forward with flavors of charred wood and a complementing moderate alcoholic heat. Finish is roasted coffee as with the normal Speedway. Flavors are all well balanced and harmonious. It¬ís a very good beer but I have trouble calling it great.

Bottled. Pours black with a small, lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, wood, bourbon, alcohol and caramel. Medium to full bodied, flat carbonation and creamy to oily texture. A great Impy. üåüüåüüåüüåü
Poured very dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of roast malt and dark chocolate. Full body, flavour as the aroma with some bourbon hints from the barrel.

750ml bottle shared with Sam and Julien. Pours jet black, dark cappuccino foamy head. Smells of sweet bourbon and roasty coffee with dark chocolate notes as well. Tastes really delicious. Roasty coffee and a lot of bourbon sweetness and heat. Small vanilla and great dark chocolate flavors. Exactly what I look for in a top stout. Great complexity in the 3-4 flavors you get and straight to the point. Full mouthfeel leaving a lasting flavor all over. Amazing. Really deserving of any hype.

Vintage 2015, servida en un Tulip Spiegelau a 55F.

APARIENCIA: de color totalmente negro, apenas algunos destellos marrones en la parte superior; corona de espuma color marr√≥n de poca retenci√≥n, de burbujas compactas y abiertas, algunos ¬ìalcohol legs¬î en la copa.

AROMA: dulce y licoroso, predomina el car√°cter de la barrica con notas a bourbon dulce, madera y vainilla, adem√°s chocolate semiamargo, ¬ìfudgie¬î como brownie, caramelo, el alcohol se percibe intenso.

SABOR: nuevamente dulce y licorosa seguida de una explosi√≥n de sabores, de inicio las caracter√≠sticas de la barrica bien presente, notas a bourbon, vainilla y madera carbonizada, seguido de predominio intenso del sabor a vainilla y caramelo, atr√°s de ello notas a chocolate semiamargo, fudgie como brownie, caramelo y en ocasiones se alcanza a percibir algo tostado del caf√© pero muy ligeramente. En el retrogusto queda un amargor ligero/medio bajo, con una larga persistencia de notas a bourbon dulce, vainilla, madera y caramelo.

Sensaci√≥n: cuerpo completo, sensaci√≥n sedosa en boca, baja carbonataci√≥n. El alcohol se percibe en boca pero no llega a ser agresivo, en garganta queda una sensaci√≥n caliente al pasar el l√≠qiuido.

RESUMEN: cerveza de clase mundial.

Black pour, tan head, good lace/retention. Aroma of bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, light coffee and roast, moderate alcohol. The coffee comes off as more muted relative to regular Speedway. Full bodied, creamy, vanilla with chocolate, light coffee flavors. I wouldn¬ít label this as the 4th (at the time) best rated imperial stout, but it¬ís still really good.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 Three way vertical of ¬í14, ¬í15, and ¬í16 at the brewery last July. Aroma is bourbon and roasted malt. Very warming on the palate. The bourbon flavor is more prevalent in the younger vintages. Finish is boozy and long with lots of malt and bourbon. Overall - exceptional beer worth the chase - with the ¬í15 my favorite of the three.
UPDATED: JAN 7, 2017 Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer.
Dark brown with a khaki lacing. The aroma is bourbon, chocolate and vanilla. The body is syrupy and the flavor is sweet.

Bottle thanks to Xebbe. Black color, minimal brown head. Chocolate aromas, bourbon wood, raisins, vanilla. Taste of chocolate, roasted malt, bourbon, vanilla, candy sugar and soy. Complex and awesome.

(750ml bottle shared with brother. Aroma: intense boozy bourbon aroma, vanilla, milk chocolate, really subtle smokiness. App: dark brown, minimal mocha head leaving little lacing. Taste and palate: full body, creamy, alcohol warming feeling and light roastiness finish. Overall: as expected this is really awesome. The bourbon takes a big place but that¬ís fine, that¬ís what I was looking for. Really good. Sweet but well balanced with the burning alcohol so it doesn¬ít feel too much. Excellent. Glad I gave another bottle arriving soon.

2016 barrel aged with coffee at the Alesmith barrel aged beer tasting room. Pitch black light impenetrable by flash light color. Beige thick head. Epic aroma of bourbon, chocolate, dried plums, minor tabaco. Taste is fruity chocolate, plum marmalade, minor spices, some mint. Dry chocolate warming alcohol finiy. Overall mind blowing!

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2016 Pitch black colour, minimal creamy brown head; aroma of smooth chocolate mousse, coffee, whisky, dried plum, raisins soaked in alcohol, some wood and vanilla; taste of overripe cherry soaked in liqueur, dried plum, whisky, dark chocolate, vanilla, coconut, coffee, and hints of ash; extremely strong and, at the same time, very smooth; just simply incredible! Definitely one of the best beers of my life in one of the best bars I¬íve visited so far (Himmeriget) - can you get any more as birthday gift when you are 40?‚ò∫
UPDATED: AUG 31, 2016 2016 bottle. Pours a dark brown color with a milk chocolate head. Intense bourbon nose, cherry, maduro tobacco leaves, fresh coffee. Thick mouthfeel warm boozy finish.

Draught
Aroma-caramel, bourbon
Appearance-black, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, lpng finish
Overall-perfect

Aroma: chocolate, vanilla, biscuit, coffee, oak, cherry, marshmallows
Taste: medium sweet, vanilla, tannin, chocolate, cherry, alcohol, roasty, biscuit
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are dark chocolate, coffee, bourbon, and vanilla.

Bottle at home. Really nice, black colour. Roasted aroma with chocolate. Taste of coffee, alcolhol and roasted chocolate. nice
Draft at the source on 6/30/2016. Almost black with a tan head. Aroma of bourbon, dark malts, and oak. Taste is bourbon, chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla, oak, and coffee. Fantastic.

Flaska. Svart √∂l med gulbeigt skum. Dofter av hasseln√∂t, choklad, kaffe och alkohol. Smakinslag av kaffe, tr√§, vanilj, rostad malt och choklad. Alkoholen √§r konstant n√§rvarande. Fyllig kropp, torr avslutning.

Pours black with a small frothy brown head that fizzes away leaving an oily spotty cap, small ring and minimal lacing. AROMA: loads of bourbon, dark rich malt, coffee, chocolate, roasty, spices, herbal hops, molasses, brown sugar, dark dry fruit, slight raisin, vanilla, smoke, herbs, earthy, boozy and black peppercorn. TASTE: boozy, Oak barrel char, dark rich malt, coffee, chocolate, roasty, spices, hop spice, molasses, brown sugar, soy sauce, dark dry fruit, slight raisin, vanilla, smoke, herbs, earthy and black peppercorn. AFTER TASTE: rich roasty malt, bourbon notes, chocolate, coffee, spices and hop resin with a medium-thick rich boozy sweet finish.

Bottle courtesy of Lukas and Mads. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee and heavy bourbon. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with a warming alcohol. Oily, soft and smooth. 270616

750ml bottle @Himmeriget. Vintage 2012. 
Poured black in color with a thin brown head. 
Bourbon, wood, licorice and roasted malt in aroma.
Had turned quite dry. Ashy, woody, some bourbon notes. Medicine notes, vanilla in finish. Heavy stuff.
Bottle 0.66l at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Vintage 2012. Colour is black with very small brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Coffee, some bourbon, dryness, softness and roasted malts.

Type: 12-oz. draft (was supposed to be eight ounces)
Glass: Clear snifter glass
From: Alpine Beer Company Pub in Alpine, Calif.
Price: $8.00
Purchased: Feb. 23, 2016
Consumed: Feb. 23, 2016
Misc.: AleSmith Tap Takeover night

First time reviewing this, but third time tasting it. Picked this over Vietnamese Coffee variant, assuming I would get to have that next (this did not happen). Loved it the last two times I tasted it and expecting at least a 4.50.

Poured a black color with one finger of khaki tan head when I got it. Minima lacing on the sides of the glass. Average retention. (Sight - 3.75)

Smelled toffee, smooth milk chocolate, buttery bourbon syrup, caramel, roasty malts and wet cocoa powder. (Smell - 4.50)

Tasted much boozier than the smell. Super hot from the get-go. Bourbon heavy, chocolate, toffee, caramel and smooth dark milk chocolate. Bourbon was just overwhelming. (Taste - 4.25)

Full body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Boozy, warming finish. (Feel - 4.25)

Not quite as good as the last few times I had this at AleSmith. Not sure what it was, but picked a bad time to review this. Will have it again for sure though. (Overall - 4.25)

4.28 95 A

Bottle thanks to Rob! Pours opaque black with a medium brown head. Aroma is coconut, caramel, coffee, cocoa, fudge, molasses and chocolate brownies. Taste is thick maple syrup, caramel, cocoa bitter, cocoa sweet, vanilla, oaky bourbon, coconut, molasses. Thick as fudge. Coats the mouth and glass.

# 2500 2006 750 ml bottle. #62/235. Pours a pitch black oily color with a tiny brown top. Aroma of dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak, coffee beans, barley, prunes, plums and soy sauce. Taste of dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak, coffee beans, roasted dark malt, barley, prunes and soy sauce.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2017 RELEASE 2015: pours oily black color, slightly haze, with foamy brown head. Visually low carbonation. Aroma is rich and complex: where to start? Dark and roasted malts aroma, with notes of dark chocolate, toffee, molasses, coffee, cocoa beans, hazelnuts, then esters with notes of dark, stone fruits, like cherries, berries, plums, prunes; then bourbon, vanilla, wood, etc....
Flavor: complex and rich as aroma or even more: prevailing notes of coffee, bourbon, dark malts, hops...they takes on all ingredients, which I mentioned by aroma, but they are perfectly blended in one unit. Body is full,  thick, texture silky smooth, carbonation is low to moderate. Finish is slightly sticky, dry, slightly bitter. Alcohol warmth is gentle noticeable, bourbon slightly boozy Incredible! For sure one of the very best imperial stouts! But 45$ is too high.
Oh boy just filled my bath tub trick or treat this baby ooooooooooh boy. Puts hair on my chest.
Roasted aromas of whiskey and wood. Deep dark beer with creamy brown head. The creamy roasted flavor is thick and carry the vanilla bourbon softly. Really good.
Smells real boozy, but doesn¬ít taste boozy. A lot of chocolate. Smooth. Vanilla. Thick. Bourbon at the end. Thx ibrew2or3. Totally lives up to hype, i want more. Shared w chris, miley, and goof.

Top marks to Benny H for this wan... 
Thick black and a cushion of brassy tan head. Nose is rich sweet strums of melted toffee and booze, very little choc unless you¬íre reaching for it. All in this was a big steam ash of soft coconut, lightest drying choc and the best boozy sweetness I¬íve had in a long time. A real hug of a mouthfeel, prices of bourbon on the linger. Came and went too quickly. Would have loved a cheeky blend of this and the Hawawawain.

Bottle. Black with tight tan head. Glorious aroma, coconut, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, molasses, char. Taste is beautifully balanced, coconut, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, molasses, char, all in equal proportions and nothing overpowering. Silky smooth and creamy texture with moderately long finish. This beer is as close to perfection as you¬íre going to get
Bottle at the hanging bat. Pours black, nose is toffee, vanilla, coconut, chocolate, taste is similar, sweet, chewy toffee.

Bottle. Vintage 2012. New Year¬ís Eve beer shared with my wife. Appearance is thick black with mocha head. Aroma charred oak, vanilla, and coffee. Taste is vanilla, fudge, followed by oak, with a bitter coffee finish. Medium mouthfeel. Tons of barrel character in this, lots of coffee flavour also, but the barrel is very prominent in this. It¬ís a much bolder version compared to the original. Very good, but a bit much for my lady.

incredible aroma! molasses, wood (smoke?) vanilla, wood, bourbon. 5 for app and palate. Taste was velvet. this was bottled 10/13.... bourbon notes, chocolate, malt. warming alcohol burn at end. one of the finest beers ever! Thank you to a wonderful trader who sent this to me!!!

Well I more or less feel they have destroyed a very good beer. This must be heaven for barrel aged lovers. Because the barrel aging had destroyed most of the other flavors. And it have become an two dimensional beer. Whisky and chocolate. Ok. Nothing wrong with the beer. Just a bit boring. I have more of these bottles and will surely trade them for something more complex than this.[Bottle from Systembolaget web order in Sweden]

This is a big bourbon barrel aged stout that has been good consistently one of the best. Deep dark colors and tastes right on point with not too much bourbon and the addition of coffee brings out some vanilla and chocolate flavors. Really great taste on the palate and a BA Bourbon beer that everyone should try. Cheers!
Svart √∂l med ett l√§tt ljusbrunt skum. Doft av m√∂rk choklad och bourbon. √Ñven rostad malt och karamell. I smaken tillkommer l√§tta inslag av fat och lakrits. F√∂redrar orginalet.

Bottle via trade; shared with Streets, his dad, Kevin, Clay, Baron and Danny in the hotel room prior to Street¬ís and Annie¬ís wedding. Pours a deep pitch black with bright tan lacing. Aroma is sweet sugar, plum, bourbon, chocolate syrup and brownie. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with notes of rich chocolate, bourbon, sweet sugar, plum, wood and brownie. A bit too much sweetness to really love it, but it¬ís a solid bourbon-aged stout.

Bottle [from trade with jtclockwork, huge thanks!] 2006, no. 103/235, shared with Dutchdrebus @ weekly tasting. Opaque black color, small brown head. Aroma is malts, bourbon, port notes, a hint of red fruit, red wine. Taste malts, bourbon, red wine, port notes, some roast, medium bitterness. Medium body and carbonation. It¬ís clear that the beer has a couple of years on it sort of speak, but it¬ís still pretty good. If only I could have tasted it back then..

Bottle 103/235 anno 2006 @ benzai. Black colour with a small beige head. Smells sweet, roasty, chocolate, raisins, boozy, port. Tastes roasty, chocolate, red fruits, raisins, oak, wood, port, slightly appelstroop, syruppy. Full body, deep, soft carbo, intense.
Tar black pour with aroma of vanilla, coffee, licorice, and some alcohol. Coffee flavor with some vanilla, subtle bourbon, and chocolate. Awesome beer!

OMFG. Bomber to tulip. Appearance: opaque black with a two-color(off-white/tan) head that leaves sparce but good lacing. Aroma: coffee, bourbon, bitter chocolate, burnt sugar, molasses, vanilla, oak, etc. Taste: similar

Draft. Pours near black with a beige head. Rich bourbon and fudge, with coffee, vanilla, and mild roasted malts. A bit boozy, but not overwhelmingly so. Obviously rich and sweet, but drinkable for the 4 ounce pour I had. Can¬ít imagine ever wanting 22 ounces of this in one sitting though, even though I definitely liked it. 8 ounces would probably be the sweet spot for me. Anyway, good stuff.
750ml bottle of 2015 release. Pours a thick black color with a good amount of head. Good carbonation for the high abv. Rich coffee flavor balanced nicely with the mild bourbon flavors.
75 cl systembolaget. Vad s√§ger man! Fantastisk! Fick bara √∂ppna denna om jag sprang under 1.30 p√• Halvmarathon! Det blev 1.27 och en grym √∂l!

A MASSIVE thanks to Matt for this awesome bottle! Much appreciated man! D√©gust√©e en compagnie de Yan ainsi que de Mademoiselle Irina. Pendant cette longue d√©gustation, les mots prononc√©s furent rares et les orgasmes papillaires nombreux. Est-ce le meilleur stout imp√©rial que j¬íai bu de ma vie? Peut-√™tre pas, mais il tr√¥ne fi√®rement sur l¬íimmense podium de la formidabilit√©! La bi√®re noire assombri soudainement la terrasse en ce jour pr√©cis d¬í√©clipse lunaire. Le liquide est surmont√© d¬íune magnifique et l√©g√®re mousse blanche que je ne me lasse de contempler. Des dentelles, lacings, formes g√©om√©triques diverses et irr√©guli√®res... Une Grande complexit√© au nez o√π tous ces ar√¥mes sont savamment balanc√©s: anis, bourbon, caf√©, m√©lasse, cassonade br√ªl√©e au chalumeau, vanille et noix de p√©can r√¥ties. C¬íest prodigieux! Les signes d¬íun subtil vieillissement se font sentir mais peu-importe, c¬íest merveilleux! Texture laiteuse; alcool brun et chaud. Le liquide coule le long de ma langue avec une sensualit√© √† peine ponctu√©e par une faible p√©tillance me rappelant qu¬íil s¬íagit ici d¬íune bi√®re. Je passe du massepain √† la cr√®me p√¢tissi√®re en passant par l¬í√©clair au chocolat. Longueur admirable et mesur√©e laissant les saveurs caram√©lis√©es s¬í√©tirer longuement et doucement. Seigneur J√©sus, faites que ce moment de Bonheur que nous partageons sur cette terrasse ne se termine jamais!

Huge bourbon notes. Followed by sweet chocolate cake with a bit of coffee roast notes and hints of dark fruit, raw oak, vanilla, a touch of roasted malt. This is decadent, complex, and luscious. The most prominent aromas as bourbon and rich chocolate, and they intermingle perfectly. It¬ís got a perfect level of carbonation that decreases to a nice smooth, silky satin as the beer warms.

750ml bottle enjoyed @ home. 2013 vintage thanks to doc_absynthe. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, raisins, vanilla, bourbon and chocolate. Flavour is medium sweet and light bitter. Full bodied, oily, very soft carbonation. Finish is roasted and well-balanced bourbon barrel character.
pitch black, vanilla aroma, some roast, malty. Creamy at first, then roasty, warm finish with vanilla. tasty

Bottle from Systembolaget. 

Black with a tan head. Nicely balanced with bourbon, coffee, malt, light vanilla and some dried fruit. Quite sweet and with a big body. A very nice beer to sip.
@ Basunen 15-8-29: Stor trevlig bourbonton. Mycket mjuk och lek smak med tydlig choklad. Underbar eftersmak.

Jet black, tan head. Aroma of Bourbon, malts, strong coffee and vanilla. Sweet and bitter flavour, coffee, caramel, light wood, loads of coffee. Full body. Finish coffee, vanilla, chocolate and liquorice. Nice!(from 75cL bottle @ Sunday Bottle Share, CBC Clerkenwell; RBESG 2014, London)
Bottle shared by Bruce. Pours black with brown head. Big bourbon aroma. Taste is lots of coffee and chocolate. Great beer
The regular speedway stout is great on its own but this is just another step above that. If you are a fan of regular speedway stout you should definitely seek this out

Good stout.‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶............ Nice Color and smell! A. Good choise for a stout!!!!

Tvangsgut

Originally reviewed on 7/18/2012. 750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. 2009 vintage. Pours with a nice head. Black and viscous. Good retention. Boozy smell. Subdued coffee, especially compared to regular Speedway. Decent barrel notes of bourbon and vanilla.

Awesome flavor. Coffee comes through much more. Good chocolate and a great barrel flavor. Tingly bourbon is especially evident in the finish. Hot from the barrel, not necessarily the beer.

Thick and boozy, even if from the barrel, it¬ís a little harsh. Decent carbonation.

 Nice. Really nice. Maybe not any better than regular Speedway, but the barrel adds a nice dimension.
Bottle share. Pitch black with a pale brown head. Burnt, vanilla, caramel aroma. Full body, medium bitterness, loads of "stout" flavours.

Bottle, 2013 vintage, thnx to bytemesis. Really looking forward to this one. Pours an inky black beer with a big, beige brownish head on top. Aroma is massive licorice, bourbon, licorice and sweet caramel vanilla fudge to a whole new level. Incredible. Flavor is incredible strong, balanced, full of bourbon notes, base beer is certainly there. Very long, strong bitter sweet bourbon finish, well carbonated and overall a great beer! Awesome!

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2015 Aroma of dark mocha, clean bourbon, with almond, coconut and honey notes. Taste of chocolate, loads of it, mudcake like, hazelnuts, with some nice light bourbon inputs. A bit thin.

Bottle. Pitch black with a 1 finger mocha head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, licorice and a hint of brown sugar. Taste is a little fusel up front, giving way to oak barrel, coffee, vanilla, waffle cone and chocolate. Rich and sticky. Fantastic.

27.06.2015, 0,75l bottle @ home:
Nice brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich, mild bourbon, dark malts, oak, dark sugar, coffee, grass, vanilla, minerals, licorice, burnt caramel. Taste is slightly rich and dry, mild bourbon, grass, minerals, coffee, licorice, dark malts, burnt caramel, dark sugar, vanilla, hints og butterscotch far back in the aftertaste. Medium bitterness, slightly dry and syrupy mouthfeel. Nice one.
Flaska fr√•n SB. Smak och doft av kaffe, bourbon, fatkarakt√§r, vanilj, marsipan och torkad frukt. K√§rv, fin s√∂tma, stor beska. Fina smaker i en bra balans. Gott!

A great beer. Very malty and almost thick. I personally prefer Bells Expedition Stout but that¬ís just a personal opinion

Oct 2013 bottle poured into a snifter..cauldron black with medium light brown head..aroma of coffee,bourbon,chocolate,licorice,vanilla..initial coffee/chocolate flavor followed by bourgon,licorice,vanilla,dark fruits..then bourbon lingers nicely on the palate but not excessively..superb.

From my backlogg: 

Bottle in London 2014. Black with an brown head. Vanilla licorice dark fruits chocolate whiskey malty roasted tar aroma. Roasted woody tar licorice whiskey dark chocolate dark fruits vanilla hoppy coffee spicy flavour. This is love in a bottle :-)

Flaska fr√•n systembolaget. Svart f√§rg med lite skum. V√§ldigt mycket Bourbon i b√•de doft o smak. Vanilj, kaffe och svagt rostade toner finns d√§r ocks√•, men Bourbon-tonerna tar √∂ver det mesta. Kanske blir den b√§ttre med √•ldern, denna var fr√•n h√∂sten 2014. God, men inte som f√∂rv√§ntat.

A: Loads of bourbon on the nose! Vanilla, chocolate, coffee, liqourice. T: Salty. Follows nose very well. Oak. O: Creamy feeling. Loads of bourbon. A little too much of the bourbon Barrel aging, very nice though!
Smooth finish, especially if let sit for a bit after opening. Complex flavor of coffee, bourbon, chocolate.

750ml bottle shared at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Black color with brown head. Roasted malty aroma, milk chocolate, dark chocolate, light coffee, dark fruits, dried fruits, wood, vanilla, alcohol. Moderate to heavy sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Full silky body with soft carbonation.

Dark black in color, with foamy tan head... Pours like motor oil... Aroma of vanilla, bourbon, coffee, sweet roasted malts, toffee... Flavor is sweet vanilla, bourbon, roasted earthy coffee, light coffee bitterness on finish... Light bourbon palate and earthy coffee... Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Speedway BA ¬í14 vintage, many thanks to Marcel.

Poura a completely black color, with nearly no head at all.

Has the most distinctive Bourbon barrel presence, I have yet experienced. Despite the Bourbon dominance, coffee cuts through easily among a huge amount of wood, as well as scorched, earthy malts. Hints of molasses remind me of this being a stout, setting the balance, but nothing more, this beer is focused on its warming coffee Bourbon blend. 

Drinks throughout smooth, perfectly fitting for the full body of the beer to unfold.

Not only becomes the Bourbon recognizable on the palate very early, the oaky barrel quality seemingly stands out on itself, blending perfectly into earthy, pleasantly bitter coffee beans. As on the nose, there is a certain, almost sticky sweetness detectable in the beer, but only as a neccesary counterpart to the fiery Bourbon coffee melange, adding toffee, cocoa nibs and fudge to the blend. Liquor heat gets perfectly wrapped up by the coffee, with a sweeter, slick finish, turning into a chocolate direction at the very end, accompanied by vanilla, booze and earthy ground coffee - revealing throughout a fantastic flavour variety.

Impressive beer, huge, bold, focused, while leaving enough space on the palate to exhibit an intriguing depth. Pretty much focused on coffee and Bourbon, with a mousse au chocolate creamy nouthfeel to it, providing oak, heat, fudge and gourmet coffee.

Bottle. An Imperial Stout on the heavy side (both texture- and taste wise). Complex taste with note of milk chocolate and coffee. Notes of salt in the aftertaste. Not as sweet and vanilla dominated as a lot of bourbon stouts tend to be.

Bottle, cbc15, at mankers. Thsnks!
Brown black brown head.
Big aggressive bourbon aroma with dill crisps, vanilla, toasted coconut, chocolate coffee, licorice and alcohol.
Taste is thick with big rich bourbon flavours. Chocolate, dill, bourbon, coconut, alcohol.
Big body, soft carb, oily.

Bottle. 
Heavy stout, lots of bourbon, alcohol, chocolate, coffee. Don¬ít drink it too cold.

bottle.
black, brown head
aroma; coffee, caramel, smoke
Taste; alcohol, salty, smoke, oily feel, chocolte, coffee.

Bottled from Systembolaget. Thx RoNo
Pitch black with a small, beige head. 
Huge, roasted aroma with vinous chocolate and coffee. 
Rather sweet with liquorice and some rad in the flavour.

Bomber to a snifter. On the occasion of my mothers 80th birthday. Thick black pour with thin tan head. Sweet toffee, vanilla, dark chocolate and espresso on the nose. A full, rich, complex, layered flavor profile. Balanced with a a boozy finish. My top rated beer to date!!! Fantastic.

Bottle share. Black with small tan head. Wonderful aromas and tastes of chocolate, coffee, vanilla, oak, booze. Smooth palate. Just an outstanding beer in my favorite style. Ties with aged BCBS Coffee for my favorite beer of all time.

750 mL bottle shared with ebone1988 for his 300th rating because I'm "fucking awesome." The pour is a viscous oily black with a dark khaki colored head and a few clingy spots of excellent lace. The aroma is really something else. The bourbon and the vanilla really dominate up front. But the complexity that falls in with the chocolate and the toasted malt and coffee are just incredible. There is a mild pakiness going on with a touch of smoke on the back end. Just everything is hope for. The flavor is really good. There is a beautiful bourbon heat up front and it rolls through a plethora of pleasing flavors. Vanilla and chocolate, roasted coffee and smoked oak. The levels of complexity are great. The mouth feel is a touch thin. I like the soft carbonation and the syrupy clinginess of the beer, but I think the bourbon takes a little away from the thickness of the mouth feel. The aftertaste is incredible. Lingeringly laced with coffee, oak, and bourbon. AleSmith kills it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Beer #300, shared with koleminer20 because he¬ís fucking awesome. Aroma is unbelievable, vanilla and chocolate dominate, then barrel, then coffee and roast. Appearance is jet black, thick, tan head. Taste is roasted malt, some booze, coffee, barrel, chocolate, vanilla. Mouthfeel is smoky aftertaste, very thick, viscous, great carbonation and only a touch boozy. Overall, this is an unbelievable beer.

Heavy smell of cocoa and dark coffee. The taste is dry, cocoa, coffee, sweetness, oak barrels and soy. Strong bitterness in the aftertaste that fills the mouth forever. As I have longed to taste this beer. High expectations I had too. And I was not disappointed. Celestial good beer. A beer you can sit for hours and enjoy. Follow me @ Kung av √∂l @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Une bouteille partag√©e avec SlovakSniper. Une robe brune avec une mousse durable, un visuel quasi parfait. Un nez d¬íune profondeur et d¬íune complexit√© rarement √©gal√©. (Bottle sample @ VilleValla Pub, Link√∂ping, Mar 21 2015) Pours pitch black with a decent tan head and some lace. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, toasted coconut, raw sugar, dark bittersweet chocolate, some sweet black coffee. On the palate it is similar, heavily barrel influenced with wood and whiskey, coconut, cocoa and coffee grounds, fading into a woody, earthy, bitter chocolate/coffee finish with pervasive notes of bourbon lingering, touch of hops and faint but noticeable alcohol heat. Medium-full oily/creamy body with soft carbonation. Rich and unctuous, maybe a little heavy on the barrel characters vs. coffee, especially compared to the regular version, coming across a little sweeter and less bitter. Feels great in the mouth and not at all boozy. I really like this but will leave my bottle for a little while, think it will improve with a bit of time.

Shared a bottle with a friend. Black beer, medium brown head. Aroma of milk chocolate, coffee, vanilla, bourbon, juniper berries. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Sticky oily texture. Alcohol is noticeable. Great beer, great quality but I prefer the non barrel aged version.

March 13, 2015. Bottle at home. (Rating #1900)
Black with small dense brown head. Aroma is lots of bourbon and coffee, vanilla, chocolate, alcohol, wood. Taste is sweet and bitter chocolate, coffee, warming alcohol. Finish has coffee, some bourbon notes, bitter chocolate. Medium to full bodied, creamy texture and average carbonation.
A solid black color. Bubbly dark mocha head. A strong aroma of chocolate. Extremely creamy. A touch of alcohol strength in the end. Really good. Very smooth.

Draft at the brewery. Pours very dark brown with a fizzy bubbly light brown head. Tastes like strong alcohol, slightly sweet and slightly astringent, woody, earthy, nutty roasted malt. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like booze, woody, earthy, and dark fruits.

Tap at brewery. Pours opaque black with creamy tan head. Aroma is bourbon, oak, vanilla, chocolate, earthy notes, and some dark fruit notes. Flavor is dry and malty with rich chocolate and roast character, tons of bourbon and vanilla, some oak, and faint hops. Full body and medium carbonation.
Bottled:Black with a mid sized head.Aroma is coffee, soy sauce, ash and Bourbon.Taste is toffee, soy sauce, Bourbon, chocolate and some alcohol. Warming finish.Over rated.
chocolate, coffee, alcohol, vanilla, woody, black, black, hazy, brown foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,

Pours black with low brown head
Aromas are brilliant! Loads of bourbon, vanilla, coconuts, coffee, chocolate, alcohol
Taste is a dream as well. Muscavado, vanilla, bourbon, coffee, chocolate, alcohol
Warming and creamy body with a nice medium bitter moderately burning alcohol finish. Brilliant!

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2015 First off, absolutely amazing beer to try been looking for this one for a wile. Thanks Andrew for splitting it with me. Found this beer at engine house #9 in Tacoma, black pour thin head, Bourbon aroma, great flavor of chocolate some coffee still taste a little hop, cinnamon, licorice, and definitely the bourbon flavor, you can taste the ABV but it¬ís not overwhelming, this beer can only get better with some more age, hope I get the opportunity to try one with some age some time.

2014, beautifully dressed foiled black bottle, poured and split with Tcon. Purchased at Engine House No. 9, Tacoma. I just love it when I¬ím out and about and run in to a bottle by complete accident. This situation surely is one of those. Pours black with a light bubbly tan head. Flavor is cocoa nibs, coffee grounds, bold vanilla and spicy chocolate. Some booze sneaks into the aroma as well, but we¬íll expected. Doesn¬ít ruin things for me. I¬íve said it before, but I absolutely love it when a beer lives up to its hype. Flavor seems initially boozy, as it is. However it smooths out very nicely. Nice smooth chocolate and coffee flavors with some vanilla and sweet butterscotch. A solid, must try beer with the make up of a perfect stout. Very happy to try such a storied beer. Awesome stuff to say the least.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2015 Three year old bottle, but with black neckfoil (the print on the bottle says "with coffee and aged in bourbon barrels", so I assume it is the same thing). One of the most expensive beers I ever bought, delivered to me by my dear former colleague Maaike. I taste this a little above cellar temperature from an old port wine snifter. Black colour (but in fact an extremely dark ochre brown), thin deep beige head, a little more ¬íloose¬í than I had expected and breaking open after a short while but retaining well around the edges, with a delicate, silky lacing. The aroma is heavenly: a dense, thick, strong and intoxicating perfume of all the good things you would expect in a big stout, and more. Impressions of freshly roasted coffee beans, kahlua, orange liqueur, warm chocolate sauce, cognac, liquorice, vanilla beans, peat, leather, oaky tannins and even moist wood, gingerbread, hints of soy sauce, cooked meat, cloves and butterscotch. This liquid commands respect, nothing in the nose reveals even the faintest flaw; I¬ím beginning to understand why this beer scores so high on this site. Taste is... well, intense, to say the least: an overpowering symphony of candied fruits, espresso beans, fondant chocolate, vanilla, oak, candi syrup, dried orange peel... Difficult to point out which comes first. Carbonation is sharpish, even a bit fizzy at first; mouthfeel is thick and smooth, somewhat cloyingly sweet at first but drying more and more towards the end, over a big yet refined, oily, multi-layered maltiness. Spiciness, bitterness and intensity increase in the finish, where a strong bourbon presence takes the lead along with strong woody tannins, with a drying, even somewhat burning effect which can be felt from the tip of the tongue till deep in the throat; peppery hops are quite strong as well, and so is the remaining syrupy maltiness. The bourbon alcohol and the strong, coffeeish roasted bitterness keep struggling for dominance but remain matched. How sweet the onset may have been, the ending of this complex ale is bone dry.  This is a powerful, demanding form of liquid gastronomy in which many things are happening at the same time. Still: this is, contrary to what I had expected, probably not quite the best stout I tasted so far - the alcohol burn is just a little bit too much over the top for me, the mouth and throat keep sticking a bit with the initial candied sugariness and it is, for this particular style, a bit overcarbonated. Nevertheless: hugely complex, hugely enjoyable, very impressive with a formidable balance between sweet and bitter, both present in their most ¬ícompressed¬í and intense form. Something to be reckoned with and enjoyed carefully, concentratedly - and sip by sip. Wow, what an experience... Big cheers to Maaike!

UPDATED: APR 8, 2015 Black with tan head foam. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla oak, brownie batter. Taste is bourbon forward, strong roast, oak alongside plenty of barrel tannins. Quite rich! Medium full palate. This didn¬ít blow me away like I thought it would but still enjoyed it. Maybe wouldn¬ít pay the same price next time though.
From a 75 cl bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of prunes and dark. Berries. Flavors of bourbon, oak and vanilla. Velvety mouthfeel. Boozy finish. Superb.

Bottle split 5 ways as part of Dangerous Bottleshare 5.0. Pitch black pour with a tiny tan head. Nose is bourbon forwarded but still with the ground coffee notes and light chocolate. Taste is super smooth, sweet notes from the barrel that blends perfectly with the bitter coffee notes. Super tasty stuff!

Bomber from a trade. Pitch black color. Aroma of molasses, coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, licorice, vanilla, oak, brown sugar, almost port wine like. Very complex aromas. Very full bodied with an almost oily thick texture and a flat carbonation. Moderated sweet malty flavor with light bitterness. Sweet thick warming bourbon like finish. Happy to have tried this but not nearly as good as GI Bourbon County Stout.

Bomber from Woodmans in Waukesha, cellar aged 8 months. On Christmas night. Shared by many. Best one of the night. Best in a while, in Austin¬ís honor. The solid bittersweetness of the base beer - excellent in its own right - amplified with some tangy vanilla sweetness. Somehow the barrel aging added its smoothness, and was a definite plus. 17.8

2013 bottle, 750mL. Pours nearly black with a medium brown head. Aroma is dark chocolate, vanilla, spent coffee grinds, and whiskey. Flavor is dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla oak. Finishes strong whiskey.

Poured from bottle dark chocolate color with minimal white head. Aromas of chocolate and smoky malt. Very smooth silky mouth feel with a nice taste of chocolate and vanilla. After taste is a nice warm lingering bourbon heat. This is a super beer.

Shared with the crew. On a night of many highlights, this was perhaps the best. Big beer, but came off very smooth for the ABV. Smooth coffiee, good bourbon, vanilla, bit of barrel, dark chocolate, roast. Super thick sipper, decadent.

2012 Bottle. Big nose of vanilla, oak, coffee. Really smooth and rich for something at 12%. Lots of coffee, vanilla, and booze, that finishes nice and clean. It¬ís good, but I still have other favorites.

Good god this is amazing. Pitch black, no light seeping through even when put up to a lamp. Nose is vanilla, chocolate liqueur, wood. Flavor is flourless chocolate cake, moderate bourbon presence, prune, raisin, coffee is present but very much subdued relative to the normal speedway. Mouthfeel steers away from being too syrupy. Warming and pretty strong tannins encourage slow enjoyment.

Bottle shared by Eric at Capitol Beer from his 2013 beer run. Pours dark brown/black with a slight dark tan head. Aromas of bourbon, coffee, arguably chocolate. Wonderful aroma. Full bodied. Flavor is chocolate, bourbon, very smooth dark malt. Super delicious.

Dark thick black body. Smells like chocolate fudge. Very thick mouthfeel. Probably the thickest beet I¬íve ever had. Super sweet. Lots of whiskey taste. If you try to find coffee, you can find it over the chocolate and whisky. Really yummy.

Sample at the Uber-Kurt (10,000) Celebration on 12/13/2014 (2013, 2009 and 2007 (#167/447) bottles). Review is for the most recent, as it was past prime by the 2007 bottle. The beer pours inky black with a medium thick foamy khaki head that diminishes gradually to a film. Patchy lacing on the glass. Aroma of roasted malt, bourbon and chocolate. Full-bodied with flavors of oaky bourbon, chocolate malt , vanilla and coffee. The finish is oaky vanilla and chocolate liqueur. Excellent beer all around.

Bottle received in trade. Thank you bytemesis! Pours black with a rather small mocha head that doesn¬ít trace much trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, roasted coconut, dark roast coffee, bitter chocolate, hay, moist soil and bourbon alcohol. Taste is sweet, slightly bitter and malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood, roasted coconut, dark chocolate, dark roast coffee, moist soil, soy sauce and bourbon alcohol. Mouthfeel is round, soft, viscous, creamy, slightly boozy and near full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet, slightly bitter and malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred wood , dark roast coffee, bitter chocolate, moist soil and bourbon alcohol. Really good!

2014 vintage. this was incredibly disappointing. how can a superior non-ba stout like speedway actually deteriorate upon contact with a bourbon barrel? what kind of wal-mart brand of bourbon was sitting in those barrels?

aroma: bourbon, some oak. non-descript bourbon and oak. appearance: dark black w/ creamy brown head. taste is just bourbon and oak. not much chocolate. no coffee. little vanilla.

Bottle shared at the RBESG 2014, grand tasting 10/08/2014 Craft Beer Co Clerkenwell. Huges thanks to Bruce for this one. Aroma is big chocolate, rich dark chocolate, layered in oak and bourbon booze. Viscous oily, opaque black with a lasting medium tan head. Flavour is toasted coconut, vanilla bean and oak, rich dark choclate and smooth deept raost. Nicely integrated Barrel character really adds to the base beer. Palate is Thick and velvety, smooth carbonation and hint of sweetness.

Pours black with a medium tan head. Very nice pitch black that¬ís kinda matte black. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla, muscovado sugar, slight alcohol fumes and some slight berry tartness. Taste is incredible! Complex, yet amazingly well integrated: chocolate, coffee, bourbon, slight vanilla, muscovado sugar, some hints of berry tartness. Mouthfeel is smooth and velvety with almost no carbonation. Just bloody amazing!

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, muscovado, chocolate, dried dates and prunes, raisins, very sweet, very good! Taste is an odyssey of sweet bourbon barrel coffee, vanilla and chocolate imperial stout. Boozy and sweet lingering finish. Rich creamy body with soft carbonation.
Un liquoreux festin caf√©ine aux assauts d√©cadents de bourbon et de chocolat noir et gras. L¬íamertume est longue mais ne bouscule pas. Dessert incontournable.
Pretty straight bourbon smell. Full body with low carbonation but not what I would call thick or oily. Taste is nice chocolatey, malty, and bourbon.

2012 vintage bottle, poured into snifter glass. Appearance is jet black, minimal tan head that quickly fades to a ring, leaving some swirls of lacing. Nice legs on this beer as well. Aromas are dominated by bourbon. Light hints of roast, coffee and chocolate linger...but, the sting of bourbon keeps coming forward. The taste is more subdued than I expected in terms of the barrel inflection. Nice balance between a creamy chocolate and bitter coffee backbone. Nice roasted notes blend with the bourbon barrel character and harmonizes nicely with some oak, vanilla and slight alcohol notes.

Cask at the brewery. It poured a black color with a tan head. The aroma was of bourbon, vanilla, oak and leather with chocolate notes. The taste was of bourbon notes, oak, vanilla, booze, raisins and coffee. Just awesome.

Aroma: intense bourbon, vanilla, heavy bread and grain malts, prunes. Appearance: black, medium, creamy, beige head. Taste: heavy sweet. Palate: massive bourbon sweets continue, alcohol, same flavours as in palate, prunes, intense vanilla with caramel. Overall: incredibly nice Imperial Stout, the bourbon cask makes a massive difference. Pint at AleSmith Brewing Company, San Diego.
10/16/2014. On tap at the brewery. Black with a beige head. Roasted malt, booze, chocolate, coffee. Complex, balanced and thick. One of the best imperial stouts out there.

Poured from 750ml into snifter. Overwhelming bourbon aroma. Thin bodied. Lots of bourbon and not much else. Harsh carbonation. Way too hot for 12%. The base beer seems lost in all this. Not sure if this was a bad bottle or improperly stored (1.5 years old bottle procured in a trade), but it was not awesome. I was so hyped for this and was massively let down.

Pours a dark black with brown head. Has a strong bourbon, coffee, and chocolate aroma. Starts a little sweet with cocoa but turns to really strong bourbon and dark liquors, some coffee and malts. A strong coffee, liquorish, and dark liquor aftertaste.

2012 bottle shared by Brad. Oily beige head. Black brown opaque body. Rich caramel booze tones. Excellent cocoa, vanilla, barrel tones. Rich, a slow sipper. Almost approaches birch tones every so often.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2015 Bottle from 2012. Thanks to Matt for hooking me and ma bros up! Man have I been looking forward to this?? Oh yes! Pours Pitch black with a brown lasting head. WOW the aroma. Oh boy! The aroma just have everything you want from a bourbon barrel aged imperial stout. Lots of fresh coconut, vanilla, oak, fresh speedway stout coffee, nice and smooth milky chocolate, fudge, some oak as well which contributes to such a nice and decadent note. Also some weak buttery notes and some sweet dark fruits as well. Taste has lots and lots of sweet bourbon notes. I get tons of coconut, dry oak, vanilla, weak buttery notes, smooth and creamy milk chocolate, roasted coffee, dark dried fruits and some fudge as well. This is one delicate decadent imperial stout. Smooth gentle and balanced. I really really like this beer :) !

Bottle, 2012! Pours da pitch wiv big, brown, bubbly, long lasting head. Aroma has .. here we go: Vanilla, chocolate, fresh coconut, dry oak, molasses, gasoline, semi roast, speedway coffee, toffee, caramel, dark, sweet, dried fruits. Taste has milk chocolate, sweet, sugary fruityness, again lots of coconut, some roast, coffee, sweet toffee, caramel, lots of bourbon, vanilla and so on. Actually no extraordinary flavors, but just a lot of coconut, and an excelent balance. Only thing to mention is a slightly sugary ending. Extremely smooth body and low carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2015 Batch ¬í12. Bottle shared with vestergaard and rasmusott. Pours pitch black with a dark brown mocha head. Aromas of smooth bourbon. Results in a vanilla sweetness, coconut, fudge, dark sweet fruits, dark roasted coffee beans, milk chocolate. Taste is pretty strong roasted coffee up front, fudge, vanilla, bourbon, coconut, milk chocolate sweet dark fruits. Oaky dry roasted finish.

"man...anything i criticize in this brew is nitpicking, but i am comparing it to the best of the best of the best. i can make a case that it is my favorite barreled stout, which is my favorite substyle as well, but i can make that case for BA Blackout, Abyss (certain years), Firestone 13...as well. bourbon slightly more prevelant than i though it would be, especially side by side with a 2009 "regular" speedway. that said, every sip gets better, and it¬ís great from the start...bourbon, chocolate, cofee, roastyness, and an ever so slight touch of hops. ridiculously smooth, like glass, though maybe thinner feeling than the base, though not to a fault. i definitely overpayed for this, but don¬ít regret it. definitely in the upper teir of barreled beers, impy stouts, and really all beers."

Bottle to glass. Thanks Dennis for sharing! Pours a pitch black color with a creamy brown head. Extraordinary aroma of roasted malts, vanilla, bourbon, oak, chocolate. Even better flavor with the same notes, lots of barrel-aged goodness with a fantastic roasted malt background. Creamy mouthfeel, long lingering bourbon, vanilla, chocolate. There¬ís a reason this consistently gets rated so highly. Unreal.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2017 (bottle, 2012, speedway tasting) murky brown-black colour with a frothy dark beige head. aroma of dill, vanilla icing and toasted malts, with lots of sour cherries, soy sauce and whey. flavour is mostly vanilla and caramel sauce, rather sweet, with lots of dark chocolate, some oak, ethanol and a light roasted-bitter finish. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation.


old rate: (bottle) black in colour with a frothy brown head. aroma of soy sauce, some vanilla and mango, with notes of hazelnuts, dark chocolate, fudge, cornflakes and a hint of alcohol. flavour is mostly fudge and alcohol, with lots of brown sugar, some light toasted malts, more hazelnuts and a medium toasted-bitter finish. heavy-bodied with average carbonation. 7/3/7/3/15 - 3.5
Awesome brew! Rich choclate, bourbon and coffee aromas. Huge dark choclate flavor with coffee and bourbon notes. Takes an awesome beer to the next level.
Another perfect brew from folks at Alesmith. Roast, toast biscut and bourbon nose and flavor. Loved the added dimension of the barrel aging. Some slight sherry character also added to its perfection.

[email¬†protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Clerkenwell (RBESG 10/08/2014) - black coloured pour with tan head. Dark roasted malty aroma and taste, slight burned malty notes, with chocolate, treacle, caramel, vanilla, dark dried fruits, thick mouthfeel, bourbon wooden nuances throughout. Beautiful.

Make no mistake, this is a BIG beer. Pours black with a deep brown head. Aroma is heavy chocolate, coffee, and some burnt toast. Adding bourbon and oak aromas to the chocolate intensifies the aroma. Chocolate and coffee are still present but sharpness of the malts are subdued. Alcohol and bourbon take over. Think I¬íll stay with the Vietnamese version.
Bottle shared at tasting. Big chocolate and creamy stout with light taste of cocoa throughout and some barrel age. Nice.

Much better than the original beer. More complexity but in the same time very ¬ísoft¬í or silky. Some of the things I found in aroma and taste: dark chocolate, coffee, licorice, dark fruits, wood (barrel, but also fresh cut wood), vanilla, .... Very well balanced, very good.

2013 bottle. Bottle shared with cards04. Dark black body with brown quickly fading head. Aroma of bourbon, warm malts, biscuit and booze. Taste is bourbon first then cocoa and faint touch of coffee and tomatoes. Less coffee-centric than the original.  A touch of booze but quite smoothe palate. Excellent beer.

This is one special beer. Pours black with quickly receding tan head. Aromas are heaven. Vanilla and bourbon dominate. Than some nutty aromas come through with caramel in there too. Flavors are more chocolate than coffee for me. Bittersweet chocolate, some coffee, boozy heat as well. Awesome stuff.

From a bottle at hotel room before going to day two of fuck yeah festival 2014. The pour Is dark brown with a white head , above average c02 compared to other bba beers . The great presence in aroma and taste is bourbon yet the aroma is more strong than the taste or palate with a ton of coffee and chocolate. This is my standard of a bourbon barrel aged Russian imperial stout.

How: Bottle.
Where: RBESG 14 Small Tasting.
Appearance: Black colour with a small tan head.
Aroma: Dried fruit, apricot, tropical fruit, raisin, vanilla.
Body: Full body, low carbonation. Oily thick mouthfeel.
Flavour: Vanilla, dried fruit, apricot, chocolate, alcohol, roasted malt, some whiskey.

Black with a light chocolate head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, vanilla, oak, dark fruits, coconut, pecans. Full bodied, sweet and rich on the palate, smooth finish. Taste is chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, dark fruits, fudge.

Bottle - Boozy barrel, molasses and roast malts. Jet black with a thin brown head. Boozy bourbon notes, intense coffee and syrupy molasses. To overpowering and big, you lose any subtly or flavours that should be there. I prefer the original.

Bottle Craft clerkenwell RBESG14. Black beer lasting tan head. Vanilla chocolate sponge cake. Still a great base beer. Lovely chocolate not sure the barrel ageing helps. Vanilla. some heat om finish. Not as good as the original.
Bottle...Pour is dark black with a fading white head..Nose is bourbon, chocolate, toast, vanilla, oak, spice..Taste is chocolate, spice, roast, creamy,
Snagged a bottle of this from across the border in WI. Spendy! $42 damn! Awesome beer though, subtle on the booze and tastes like a less strong BCBS.

2013 vintage. 750 ml bottle into a snifter. Pours a pitch black with a finger of light mocha foam. Nose is dark chocolate, espresso, light licorice and tons of bourbon. Vanilla, oak, and sugary marshmallow. Smells hot. The taste is smooth chocolate leading into slightly faded but not stale coffee. Vanilla and oak linger in the background. Great balance of sweetness and roastiness. Incredibly creamy and smooth mouth feel. This is a top notch barrel aged stout, and probably just a notch below fresh BCBCS. Can¬ít imagine how good this must be fresh or any of the variants.
Bottle thanks Phil. Black pour with tan head. Coffee, roasted bourbon and sweet tones. Coffee forward, roasted, bourbon and sweet tones.

Pours a thick motor oil black with a nice dark tan head. Nose is vanilla, whiskey and oak. Smooth flavor with notes of vanilla and whiskey followed by a nice coffee aftertaste. Excellent RIS. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amazing! Thanks to joedevivre for the share and 600th rating. Oily black pour. Nose dances with coffee, chocolate, oak, vanilla, caramel, leather. Taste is equally wonderful. Fair sweet but cut by the booze and little bit of bitterness. Heavy mouthfeel, but great for sipping.

Bottle: Thanks GTH: Served in a Duvel glass:
Medium to smaller sized brown head on top of a black colored beer.
Aroma keeps playing with the nose: one time a lot of vanilla and some coffee, than there is loads of strawberry and some other red fruit, than it changes again and spreads some berries and finally there¬ís a good deep dark roast with dark chocate, whiskey and coffee.
Good aroma for sure!
Flavours of dark chocolate, spice, whiskey, marzipan, vanilla, wood roast, bitters, some mocha, cacoa, coffee, some espresso, malt roast, some coffee beans, cream and some oat.
Aftertaste is coffee, bitters, roast, mocha, some whiskey, some malt roast, light vanilla and some oat.
Low carbo, light creamy light oily mouthfeel, full bodied and light oily light sticky warm and spiced texture.
Awesome beer, balanced, deep, transforming and tasty!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle share at Tribes Alehouse. Pour is oil black with a small tan head. Aroma of dark chocolate, bourbon heat, coffee creamer, vanilla beans, leather, and roast. Flavor is similar with a bit more alcohol present, roasty finish.
Black pour. Small tan head. Little tiny bit of lacing. Big malty aroma with notes of booze.
Bottle share thanks to Homer. Aroma of strong bourbon and chocate. TAste is sweet, chocolate, coffee, bitter in the aftertaste. Good beer.

Bottle share thanks to Homer321. Pours a deep dark nearly black with large light brown head. Lots of bourbony, barrel character, vanilla, oaky, roasty, chocolate aroma. More of the same is the flavor. Lots of boozy, bourbon flavor, some oak and vanilla, roasty, and more booze in the finish.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks DSG.Black with tan ring. Sweet, some coffee, bourbon-originated vanilla, some ink and some soy aroma, rich taste - chocolate and bourbon, some coffee too. Full body, smooth, coffee finish, a little burnt. Round and amazing.

750 ml bottle at home - 2009 vintage. First of all, this one held up very well!. Pours pitch black with a steady light beige head. Intense dark chocolate nose with green coffee beans and small green paprica hints. A-typical american stout (I guess due to a disproportional amount of hops?). Medium body with a nice sweet roasty start, alcohol burn as from the mid. Taste of ultra dark chocolate and mocca... Interested in tasting more of them!

This pours a pitch black color with a medium brown head. The aroma is ever so boozy mixed with roasted hints of bourbon and vanilla. The texture is thick, smooth, and delicious. This seems to be a lighter, less robust version of the normal Speedway Stout but the flavor are much deeper and more complex. Well worth the extra money if you ever get the chance to buy it.

Split bomber with Sherm1016.....thanks!

Pours black with thin tan head..nose is bourbon, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, bourbon and coffee. Initial taste is WOW....more chocolate; vanilla, coffee.....and, of course, bourbon. Excellent....vanilla finish. This is really tasty.

#1000. Bottle. 2013 vintage. Black. Small creamy, soapy brown head, forming a lasting ring with a wispy topping. Aroma is bourbon, dark chocolate, and coffee, full and rich but not overpowering. Some vanilla, and light woody spiciness. Big full luscious body. Velvety. Wow. First sip. Amazing. Perfect alcohol warming. No heat. Flavor also finds the smooth bourbon, chocolate, bittersweet coffee, vanilla, and wood. So rounded and well integrated. Such balance. Never cloying. Not too sweet or bitter or roasty or boozy - Juuuuust right. A beer where each element isn¬ít trying to yell over the other. Nor is it weighed down by a dozen different things fighting for your attention. World class.

Very rich, sweet, dark aroma. Sweet dark fruit, alcohol, sugar, bourbon, dark bittersweet chocolate, vanilla. Taste is so strong, smooth. Vanilla, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, bitter, sweet, smooth, strong. Like shockingly smooth. So good.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2015 Taster from cask at brewery. Pours a pitch black with a one finger tan head with excellent lacing. Aroma is of freshly roasted coffee, nice bourbon, chocolate, raisins, licorice, vanilla, roasted malts, burnt brown sugar, oak, and roasted malts. Taste is of nice bourbon, coffee, a lot of chocolate, dark fruits (mainly raisins), licorice, vanilla, molasses, oak, burnt caramel and smooth roasted malts. Has a full body with a super creamy, oily mouthfeel, and a semi bitter, smoothly slightly boozy, lingering, long finish. Overall, a amazing, world class stout that is truly the best beer brewed in San Diego.

750ml bottle from Downer Wine and Spirits, split with dwm1034. Pours a jet black color with a thin tan head.aroma is bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, some coffee. Heavy on the palate with soft, creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, oak, vanilla, more chocolate, with a sweet, vanilla finish. Excellent.
Backnote, had this beer at the zeebra extreem beer festival 2014. coffee chocolate bouron

Bottle shared by Ben at the GTMW ticket line, pours pitch black with a thick dark brown head and lacing in the glass, the aroma was of heavy coffee at first with a chocolate backing and bourbon showing through as well, the flavor again was of heavier coffee at first with a fudge and chocolate finish, the bourbon shows through out the drink and is not overwhelming in the least bit but compliments it more than anything, nice vanilla notes show through as well, good stuff.
UPDATED: DEC 8, 2014 Bottle. Way better than the normal Speedway. Lots of smooth coffee of course, but also a smooth taste of vanilla. Balanced and awesome.
Sampled @ Zeebra 2014. Awesome beer. This is how I like them. Very heavy and thick. Rich, sweet, coffee. Nice!

2013 bottle thanks to dogday. Shared with John. Pours oily black like all Speedways, a nice small foamy head that collects to a ring and sits there. Aroma is fresh roasted coffee, rich chocolate fudge, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate syrup, raisins, and licorice. Tastes like a perfect mix bourbon, chocolate syrup, and fresh coffee. Moderate brown sugar-like sweetness and just a touch of bitterness. Nice smooth booziness in the finish. Medium to full body with a great oily slick mouthfeel. This is right up there with my favorite barrel aged stouts.
Pours a pitch black beer with a good brown head. Smells chocolate, coffee, vanilla, bourbon. Tastes vanilla, chocolate, bit bourbon. Very nice. Low carbo, medium body and a sticky oily texture.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2016 Mooie zwarte kleur met een goede bruine kraag. Ruikt vol, koffie, chocolade, gebrand, vanille. Beetje alcohol. Smaakt vol, koffie en vanille, cr√®me, hout, drop, alcohol. Goede bittere nasmaak. Iets alcohol nasmaak.

2013 Vintage. 75 cl. bottle. Obtained in a trade with AdamJackson. Thanks. Poured into a shaker. Pours black with a small but gorgeously lacing coffee coloured head, I mean that few beers lace as beautifully ast this one. Looks lovely. Smells of very thick molasses, nicely boozy bourbon, thick mocha, chocolate cake, sweet cinnamon, lots of vanilla oak, touch sweet liquorish, nicely full and rich with bourbon, thick syrupy quality with chocolate sauce. Tastes of coffee, lot of vanilla, molasses, very warming, alcohol burn, almost a bit like someone poured a shot of bourbon in here, bitter coffee roast, roast is more presence here than in most beers of this style, alcohol lingers, some bitter herbs, syrup, chicory, lingering bitterness. Quite nice and decadent Bourbon BA RIS, almost too aggressive for its own good, this almost feels like a far better Black Tuesday to me. Nicely aggressive beer to nurse slowly at home. I haven¬ít been too exited about AleSmith so far but this is right up my alley. One could debate till the end of times about this beer being deservingly or undeservingly #6 on RB (well that is if you are a beer geek, you could debate forever), I do not care about the top 50. I have had enough of the top 50 for this to be genuine dislike and not just jealously of those that do have the whales :) And yeah drinking the whole bottle will get you quite buzzed.
Bottle. Sweet boozy bourbon, oak, vanilla, chocolate, coffee aroma. Black with a small tan head. Chocolate, coffee, woody bourbon, vanilla, and alcohol flavor. Full sticky body, soft carbonation.

Yep...!
Pours pitch black, with a small "bubbly" tan head. - Be looking real juicy and stuff!! 
Aroma is packed with coffee, bitter chocolate, vanilla, caramel, roasted malts, bourbon, wood character - plenty of delicious woody notes indeed - hot damn this tastes good.. 
Tastes pretty sweet, but has a nice amount of bitterness, combined to a super well balanced and complex brew. I¬ím telling you, layers of flavors boy!! 
Semi-full bodied, with a semi flat carb.Thanks a big bunch to Mr. Doodler for sending this out my way.!!

Bottle thanks to boutip, 2009 vintage. Appearance is a nice full black with decent brown mocha head. Aroma is quite straightforward with bourbon, vanilla, the usual Alesmith divine caramel and molasses. You can definitly feel the high alcohol content which brings the ripe fruits upfront along with bourbon and caramel notes. Flavors are hard to describe as they aren¬ít amazingly complex but so well integrated and intense. Bourbon and age seem to have completly taken over coffee from the regular version. As much as I like the regular version, BA speedway lifts this one to a new level without being over the top. Exactly what I expect from a bourbon barrel version.

Side-by-side with Black Note with BA speedway being a close winner. Although I prefered Black Note¬ís palate and aroma, BA speedway¬ís flavors were out of this world. My favorite stout aside from BCS Rare.

Bottle sample at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks DSG. Pours black opaque with a brown head, aroma of bourbon, caramel, coffee, congac, brandy, coconut and wood, flavor of coconut, cognac, scotch, wood, dark chocolate, coffee, thick, full bodied. Nice.

Sample thx to Mathieu87!
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, small stable beige head.
NOSE: bourbon, vanilla, mocha, alcohol, coffee.
TASTE: bourbon, alcohol, vanilla, sweet.

Bottle shared at a tasting at the Beer & Beyond shop. Thanks troganmi for this bottle! Bottled 26/3/13. Black with a small brown head. Great aroma full of coffee, bourbon, some vanilla, a coconut note and a bit of dark chocolate. Bittersweet flavor, roasty, coffee-ish, with dark chocolate, bourbon, coconut and vanilla. Full-bodied with a mild warming boozy finish. Great stuff.
Bottle pours black with big head, aroma is rich sweet chocolate and sweet booze and roast finish. Taste is similar with a nice chocolate finish. Great beer. no overpowering alcohol, really nice

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2014 shared bottle, poured a pitch black colour with a nice beige head. roasted malts, coffee, milk chocolate, dark chocolate, vanilla, oak, bourbon, thick and smooth mouthfeel. really awesome stuff!! but the vietnamese speedway is a bit better!

Pours black with a cappuccino head. Aroma is strong on the bourbon, tons of vanilla and oak, also leather and chocolate notes. Taste is also strong with the bourbon barrel notes, oak and vanilla, pretty boozy, raisins and coffee. Really good, but i think i prefer regular speedway.

The foam has both dense and larger bubbles... Seen this in many a bomb stout. Good lacing too. Gets more and more dense over time. The nose is so perfekt, restrained corn whiskey, vanilla, hard roast and dry licorice powder.. So complex, layers of flavour I dont know where to begin. Nice aftertaste too. I¬ím sold. @mothebrother thank you kindly for sharing.
2013 Bottle. Wow! It¬ís hard to believe how smooth this beer actually is! So complex and refines, just the right amount of bourbon with beer!
Dark dark brown color. Great bourbon taste. Lingering aftertaste of bourbon. Served at room temp out of the cask.

Bottle. Poured black with a thin tan head. The aroma was absolutely amazing, with coffee, rich chocolate and bourbon. Taste was a silky smooth bourbon/chocolate front that went to coffee then back to the bourbon. Really well done. Definitely going to hunt this down again.

Bottle shared by cptnspeed1...thanks Brad! - Pours black with a bubbly tan head. Nose is coffee and dark roast, kind of plasticy--real sweet and bourbony. Taste is bitter and roasty, sweet bourbon, a bit of roastiness, coffee, and vanilla. Thick and slick, and not much carbonation. This one fell a little flat...I wish I liked this one because Brad brought this one special for me. Thanks Brad--I still felt like it was just you and me at that tasting. [call me!]

(bottle - 750 ml - 2012 vintage) Dark black oily pour with a thin tan head. Huge aroma of coffee and bourbon with some cream and vanilla at the end. Flavor is just ungodly good. Bourbon and coffee and sweetness with more bourbon in the middle that really swirls around and just perks up the coffee and chocolate bitterness. Finishes smooth and sweet from the wood and vanilla. Incredible.

2004 bottle (10 y/o at time!) generously shared by Jay (SpringsLicker) at the RBWG. Thank you! Shiny, oily black pour. So luscious with loads of milk and dark chocolate liqueur and notes of sweet marshmallow, and merengue cookies. This bad boy has held up great! Given the age on this thing, I think I can also attest that Jay¬ís cellar is excellently prepared.

2004 vintage bottle shared at RBWG grand tasting! Pours a thick black with light head and lacing. Aroma is wow, barrel aged awesome, dark and full with a nice sweet balance. Taste follows, smooth and incredibly easy for the alcohol. Alesmith really knows how to make beers that age.

Pour is ink black with a well retained brown head. Aroma is marshmallow, roast, vanilla, and oak. The taste is creamy marshmallow, coconut, nuts, roast, and some barrel. This beer is oh so smooth and really tasty. I¬ím very glad that I was able to try this.
2004vintage. Bottle pour opaque black. Nose bourbon,sweet malt,hint of ash. Taste smooth mix of bourbon, chocolate,and mild roast. I believe has mellowed with age.
750ml bottle pours a dark black with a dark tan head. Big bourbon vanilla and chocolate chip taste. Bourbon and chocolate aroma.

Shared with Mike and Mike! Thanks Mike? Black with a small tan head. Aroma of coffee and roasted malt, with hints of licorice and vanilla. Sweet dark flavour of coffee, licorice, roasted malt and caramel, with a touch of alcohol. Hints of oak before a slightly ash finish. Milder than I thought it would be.

Sampled 4 times at various tastings. Pours a night black color with small tan head. After some time in glass, nice big aromas of silky chocolate, slight barrel, vanilla, hints of toasty coffee. Silky smooth palate rich with layers of chocolate with warm milk, a bit of toasted nuts, some oaky spice/bourbon spirit. Alcohol is well integrated and an outstanding beer.
Aroma is very boozy with some chocolate and coffee. Dark pour with a thick brown head that dissipates quickly. Flavor is more whiskey than bourbon. Luscious. Big thanks Justin!

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2014 2013 bottle. Pours a nice velvety black with a mocha tan head that lingers for a while. Smells of bourbon, coffee, chocolate, and a nice roasty finish. Tastes are delicate all around, coffee is not overwhelming. Love how it feels going down. One of the best

Bottle poured a black color with a coating of thick mocha head that fell back to a ring that it did hang onto for a while. Aroma has big roasted malt, mild bourbon barrels, chocolate, mellow coffee, and sweet touches. Mouth feel is big and chewy with hefty coating and steady low side carbonation. Flavor has plenty of roasted malts, dark chocolate, bourbon barrels, mild black coffee, and a lingering rich finish. The beer has all the qualities of the regular speedway and barrel treatment levels are not so over the top it takes over the beer. This has been a long time wanted beer that I remember from my early days here was incredibly difficult to get and I am quite happy to finally have the chance to have one!

750ml bottle in a snifter. Pours black with a lacy, tan head. Aroma of strong roasted malts, strong coffee, and strong bourbon and oak, plus a nice dark chocolate note, some vanilla, and some sweet malts. Flavor a great blend of the roasted malts, a lot of bourbon, a lot of coffee, and some sweetness/chocolate. Thick texture. Incredible.

Bottle from International Trade; dark brown pour with velvety tan head, bourbon and coffee aroma, taste has bourbon non if your face but quite mellow, sweet taste with vanilla, leather quite earthy, viscous mouthfeel, none of the speedway variants are as good as the original for me.

Shared 750ml bottle. Poured a rich, dark black color, like oil, nice small brown head. Aroma was creamy dark chocolates, bourboun. Flavor was smooth chocolate bourbon, brandy notes. Pretty solid brew. Alcohol is nicely hidden in this one.

On tap 5 oz. pour at the 2013 Strong Ale Festival at Pizza Port in Carlsbad (village), CA. 

Opaque, near black with a small tan head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of roasted malt, roasted coffee, molasses, dark chocolate, vanilla and booze. 

Taste of roasted malt, roasted coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, Scotch whiskey and caramel with a noticeable alcohol burn. 

Full/medium body and medium/low carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 bottle from Adam in trade. Poured Dec 7, 2013. Big time thanks for this one. Pours pitch black along with what looked like some coffee grinds, and a one finger mocha head. Aroma is bourbon, coffee, vanilla, roast, some chocolate, oak, light anise. Flavor is bourbon up front, light roast, vanilla, anise, chocolate, sweetness, more vanilla. Comes in waves, with that bourbon first then the layers of roast and sweetness. Much sweeter than the regular version, and I like it. Silky smooth, relatively thick mouthfeel, low+ carbonation. Sweet bourbon coats the palate and warms the throat.
pours jet black with tan lacing from 22oz bottle. Smell of boozy mocha molasses. Boozy. Good stuff very similar to bcs.
3/26/13 bottle date. Vanilla coffee chocolate. All subtile and balanced. Nothing really sticks out, just a completly solid bourbon stout.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Poured a deep mahogany with a frothy tan head. The aroma is rich roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, some creamy caramel and boozy alcohol. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a rich creamy liqourice alcohol bitter palate. An absolute whale of a beer.

UPDATED: NOV 6, 2014 Bottle shared thanks to trade with Kraddel. Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, caramel, roast and booze. Flavour is light heavy sweet and bitter. Licorice, soy and leather coming out in the palate with the aroma aspects. Oily mouthfeel with alcohol coming out in the finish. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

November 2014, shared a 2009 vintage.  Bourbon and barrel is still strong and perfectly at balance with the base stout.  Some dark fruity aspects coming out but not too much, still in balance and certainly the age has made a great beer even better.

66cl bottle courtesy of and shared with kermis, big thanks.
Thick creamy tan head. Jet black pour. Lovely woody notes. Very smooth enjoyable complex brew. Excellent
